docinfo.docinfo:doc-heading: DIVISION 3 PARTS III–XI OF THE CODE [rr 9–16]

heading.title: PART 80 COMPANIES (NEW SOUTH WALES) CODE AND CORPORATIONS LAW [rr 1–64]
DIVISION 3 PARTS III–XI OF THE CODE [rr 9–16]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: PART 80 COMPANIES (NEW SOUTH WALES) CODE AND CORPORATIONS LAW [rr 1–64]
DIVISION 3 PARTS III–XI OF THE CODE [rr 9–16]
[SCR Pt 80 r 9] r 9 Applications under ss 73, 118, 122, 123, 125, 133 and 175

p.text: This rule applies to an application for an order under any of the provisions of the Code referred to in column 1 of the Table below:

row.entry: Cancellation or alteration of the objects or powers of a company.
Confirmation of issue of shares at a discount.
Validation of issue or allotment of shares.
Cancellation, etc. of variation or abrogation of rights of holders of classes of shares
Approving payment of interest out of capital.
Confirmation of resolution to wind up scheme.

p.text: The matter in column 2 of the above Table is inserted for convenience or reference only and does not affect the operation of the rules.

Unless the Court otherwise orders, notice of an application to which this rule applies shall, not later than seven days before the date appointed for hearing, be published once in the Government Gazette and once in a prescribed newspaper.
The notice mentioned in subrule (3) shall:
in the case of an application for orders under section 123(5) of the Code and for fixing a date under section 123(3)(a) of the Code — be in Form 125 ; and
in any other case — be in Form 126 .
Evidence in support of an application to which this rule applies shall include:
a statement of the statute under which the Company was incorporated;
a statement of the date of incorporation;
unless the Company is the plaintiff or has entered an appearance, proof of:

the address of its registered office at the date of search made under this subrule, being the latest address disclosed in a notice or annual return lodged with the Commission under section 84(2)(b)(ia) , section 85(4)(fa) , section 217(1) or (3) or section 263(1) of the Code;
the date of lodgment of the notice or return disclosing that address,
as ascertained by search made not earlier than three days before:
if the summons was served on the Company by post — the date of posting; or
if the summons was served otherwise — the date of service;
unless the Company is the plaintiff, the capacity in which the plaintiff makes the application.
[subr (5) am Amendment 128: Gaz 141 of 22 October 1982 p 4889 ; Amendment 165: Gaz 103 of 12 July 1985 p 3457 ; Amendment 241: Gaz 51 of 20 April 1990 p 3280]
Rule 20 applies to an application to which this rule applies as it applies to an application for a winding up order under the Code.
[r 9 insrt Amendment 126: Gaz 90 of 30 June 1982 p 2973]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [SCR Pt 80 r 10] r 10 Reduction of capital (s 123)

p.text: This rule applies where, on an application for an order under section 123(5) of the Code, the Court fixes a date under section 123(3)(a) of the Code.
Within seven days after the date fixed under section 123(3)(a) of the Code, the company shall:
make out a list of creditors; and
file an affidavit in Form 127 verifying the list.
Copies of the list shall be kept at the registered office of the Company and be available for inspection there at all times when the office is required to be open and accessible to the public.
Within seven days after the date of filing the affidavit under subrule (2)(b) , the Company shall:
publish once in the Government Gazette and once in a prescribed newspaper a notice in Form 126 ; and
serve on each creditor whose name is entered on the list mentioned in subrule (2)(a) a notice in Form 128 .
Within seven days after the expiry of the time fixed by the Court for creditors to send particulars of their claims to the solicitor for the Company, the Company shall file an affidavit in Form 129 .

Where the Company contends that a person is not entitled to be entered on the list or disputes the amount of a debt or claim claimed by a person, the Company shall, unless the Company is willing to appropriate, as the Court directs, the full amount of the debt or claim, serve on the person a notice in Form 130 .
The Court may, on the adjudication of claims:
allow any claim and fix the amount allowed;
direct that any claim be investigated in such a manner as the Court thinks fit;
require any claimant to furnish particulars or evidence of his claim or produce any security relating to his claim; or
disallow any claim.
Where a claimant does not comply with a notice served on him under subrule (6) , the Court may disallow his claim.
In subrules (7) and (8) , claimincludes part of a claim.
[r 10 insrt Amendment 126: Gaz 90 of 30 June 1982 p 2973]
Legislation cited in [SCR Pt 80.10.1] below. LawNow subscribers click through for daily updates and historical versions.
(CTH) Corporations Act 2001 Pt 2J.1.
See Pt 2J.1 of the Corporations Act 2001.

The court must ensure that the machinery provisions of the Code have been observed and that the interest of creditors, the public and shareholders are adequately protected. The public interest includes those of future creditors and future shareholders. See generally Buckley & Parker et al, Buckley on the Companies Acts 14th ed, Butterworths, London, 1981, p 181; Paterson, Ednie & Ford, Australian Company Law, 3rd ed, Butterworths, Sydney, paras 123/17–19; Catto v Ampol Ltd (1989) 16 NSWLR 342; 15 ACLR 307 . The onus of proof lies on those who assert that the proposed reduction is unfair and inequitable and ought be rejected: Re Old Silkstone Collieries Ltd [1954] Ch 169 at 186, 189 ; Re Arcus Pty Ltd (1976) 2 ACLR 160 ; Re Ampol Ltd (1989) 14 ACLR 772 ; Re Tantalex Ltd (1986) 8 NSWLR 8 ; but cf Re Holders Investment Trust Ltd [1971] 2 All ER 289; [1971] 1 WLR 583 at 590 .

level.toc-caption: [SCR Pt 80.10.3] Dispensing with lists of creditors

p.text: The court will generally dispense with settling a list of creditors where there is no question of diminution of unpaid capital or return of cash to members: Re Tantalex Ltd (1986) 8 NSWLR 8 .
The invariable practice of the court is to require a letter from the Deputy Commissioner of Taxation that he has no objection to the reduction: Re Tantalex Ltd (1986) 8 NSWLR 8 .

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [SCR Pt 80 r 11] r 11 Reduction of capital: appointment for hearing (s 123)

leg:heading.title: Reduction of capital: appointment for hearing (s 123)

p.text: Where the Court settles the list under section 123(3)(b) of the Code, the Court shall appoint a date for hearing of the proceedings on the application for the order under section 123(5) of the Code.
[r 11 insrt Amendment 126: Gaz 90 of 30 June 1982 p 2973]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [SCR Pt 80 r 12] r 12 Registration of transfer of shares, etc (s 184)

leg:heading.title: Registration of transfer of shares, etc (s 184)

p.text: An application to the Court for an order for the issue of a summons under section 184(3) of the Code may be made without serving the summons by which the application is made on any person.
A summons under section 184(3) of the Code may be in Form 131 .
[r 12 insrt Amendment 126: Gaz 90 of 30 June 1982 p 2973]
Legislation cited in [SCR Pt 80.12.1] below. LawNow subscribers click through for daily updates and historical versions.
(CTH) Corporations Act 2001 s 1092(3).
(NSW) Supreme Court Rules 1970 Pt 80A r 4.
See now s 1092(3) of the Corporations Law and SCR Pt 80A r 4 .

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [SCR Pt 80 r 13] r 13 Failure to comply with requirements of inspector (s 297)

leg:heading.title: Failure to comply with requirements of inspector (s 297)

p.text: [r 13 rep Gaz 99 of 5 August 2005 r 3 and Sch 1 item [129], effective 15 August 2005]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [SCR Pt 80 r 14] r 14 Compromise with creditors, etc (ss 315, 317)

p.text: An application for relief under a subsection of section 315 of the Code, (which section relates to a compromise with creditors etc) other than under subsection (1) of that section, shall be made by motion in the proceedings on the application for the order under subsection (1) of that section.
Rule 9 applies to an application for an order under section 315(4) or section 317(1) of the Code as it applies to an application for an order under the provisions of the Code mentioned in rule 9(1) .

The Court may, on the application of any person whose rights are affected by a compromise or arrangement approved under section 315(4) of the Code, fix or review the remuneration of the person appointed to administer the compromise or arrangement.
[r 14 insrt Amendment 126: Gaz 90 of 30 June 1982 p 2973]
Legislation cited in [SCR Pt 80.14.1] below. LawNow subscribers click through for daily updates and historical versions.
(NSW) Supreme Court (Corporations) Rules 1999 r 3.1–3.5.
See Supreme Court (Corporations) Rules 1999 rules 3.1–3.5 at [15,220]–[15,240].

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [SCR Pt 80 r 15] r 15 Oppression or injustice (s 320(2))

p.text: Rules 18 , 19 , 20 , 21 and 22 apply to an application for an order under section 320(2) of the Code as they apply to an application for an order under section 364(1) of the Code and as if for the reference in rule 18(3)(e) to a paragraph of section 364(1) of the Code there were a reference to a subparagraph of section 320(1)(a) of the Code.
[r 15 insrt Amendment 126: Gaz 90 of 30 June 1982 p 2973]
Legislation cited in [SCR Pt 80.15.1] below. LawNow subscribers click through for daily updates and historical versions.
(NSW) Supreme Court (Corporations) Rules 1999 r 5.1.
See Supreme Court (Corporations) Rules 1999 rule 5.1 at [15,340].

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [SCR Pt 80 r 16] r 16 Release of official manager (s 355)

p.text: A person applying for an order under section 355(19) or section 355(20) of the Code shall give notice of his application:
to every creditor who has proved his debt; and
to any creditor mentioned in the report referred to in section 335(4) of the Code who has not proved his debt.
[r 16 insrt Amendment 126: Gaz 90 of 30 June 1982 p 2973]
